name: Template
flavor: This shouldn't be visible (oops!)

name: Basic Techniques
flavor: These techniques require no significant training and are automatically granted to all characters for free.

techniques.name: Quick Strike
techniques.desc: A quick blow, sacrificing striking strength for speed.
techniques.effect: Attack using your weapon's Profile. _Versatile_ Weapons take a -2 damage penalty.

techniques.name: Strike
techniques.desc: A standard strike, balancing damage and speed.
techniques.effect: Attack using your weapon's Profile.

techniques.name: Strong Strike
techniques.desc: A mighty blow, sacrificing power for speed.
techniques.effect: Attack using your weapon's Profile, dealing +1 damage bonus with a _Versatile_ weapon or +2 with a _Heavy_ weapon.

techniques.name: Run
techniques.desc: A simple dash, covering ground as quickly as possible.
techniques.move:
The movement granted by Run determines its Speed, as follows:
* Reposition: Speed 1
* Shift: Speed 2
* Sprint: Speed 3
* Dash: Speed 4

techniques.name: Disengage
techniques.desc: A careful reposition that never drops its guard.
techniques.move:
The movement granted by Disengage determines its Speed, as follows:
* Step: Speed 2
* Reposition: Speed 3
* Shift: Speed 4

techniques.name: Leap
techniques.desc: A quick hop, allowing one to avoid hazardous terrain.
techniques.special: A characer counts as _Flying_ for this action, but Melee Attacks do not receive Disadvantage.

techniques.name: Form Change
techniques.desc: By adopting a different fighting style or spirit stance, one can keep up with an ever-changing battlefield.
techniques.effect: Change your current Stance or Style.
techniques.imbue: 2 Momentum. Form Change is a Free Action.

techniques.name: Draw
techniques.desc: Switching weapons allows one to be prepared for any combat situation.
techniques.effect: Replace one or both of your Wielded equipment with a different piece of available equipment.
techniques.special: The Speed of Draw is equal to 1 + the total number of Hands of Equipment drawn or stowed.

techniques.name: Evasive Maneuvers
techniques.desc: Light on your feet, you prepare to dodge an incoming blow.
techniques.effect: Gain 1 Dodge Token.

techniques.name: Dodge
techniques.desc: You roll away, attempting to dodge an opponents strike.
techniques.effect: Force the attacker to reroll the attack. They must use the new result.

techniques.name: Guard
techniques.desc: You prepare your defenses, ready to knock away a strike.
techniques.effect: Gain 1 Block Token.

techniques.name: Block
techniques.desc: You deflect a strike with arms or armor, lessening the blow.
techniques.effect: Reduce the Attack Roll by 1.

techniques.name: Find Opening
techniques.desc: You wait for an opening, preparing to strike.
techniques.effect: Gain 1 Punish Token.

techniques.name: Counter
techniques.desc: You lean into an incoming attack, affording you the chance to strike.
techniques.trigger: You are Attacked by an adjacent enemy.
techniques.cost: 1 _Punish_, +1 _Punish_ if the Attack is Speed 4 or slower.
techniques.effect: Increase the Attack Roll by 1. You may immediately Attack the triggering enemy with a Speed 3 or faster _Maneuver_.
techniques.boost: 1 Momentum. You may instead Attack with a _Strike_.
techniques.special: The Movement of the _Maneuver_ or _Strike_ you choose becomes None.

techniques.name: Opportunity Attack
techniques.desc: You capitalize on an opening, taking the chance to assault a foe.
techniques.trigger: An enemy within your Reach makes Movement that is not Safe.
techniques.cost: 1 _Punish_ +1 _Punish_ if the Attack is Speed 3 or slower.
techniques.effect: Immediately Attack the triggering enemy with a _Maneuver_.
techniques.boost: 1 Momentum. You may instead Attack with a _Strike_.
techniques.special: The Movement of the _Maneuver_ or _Strike_ you choose becomes None.

techniques.name: Grab
techniques.desc: A quick grab, to either reposition or grapple a foe.
techniques.effect: Attack using the below Profile.

techniques.name: Shove
techniques.desc: A push, either to the ground or away.
techniques.effect: Attack using the below Profile.

name: Land
flavor: Those that practice the Land Discipline make the ground beneath their feat their weapon, creating earthen barricades and laying their enemies low with mighty tremors.

stances.name: Fortress Stance
stances.desc: A powerful stance that constructs an unassailable fortress of earth and stone.
stances.accumulate: At Refresh, gain 1 _Momentum_ for every adjacent Earthen Barricade beyond the first, to a maximum of 2.
stances.special: Whenever you are adjacent to an Earthen Barricade and are Attacked, you may pay 1 _Momentum_ to destroy the Earthen Barricade, Blocking and gaining 1 Armor against the triggering Attack.

stances.name: Sculptor Stance
stances.desc: A well-practiced Earthbonded can shape earth and stone as easily as clay, reshaping the field around them.
stances.accumulate: Gain 1 _Momentum_ for every Action you take that creates earthen _Rough Terrain_ or _Dangerous Terrain_.
stances.effect: At Refresh, you may change 2 squares of _Rough Terrain_ or _Dangerous Terrain_ made of earthen materials into your choice of Normal, Rough, or Dangerous Terrain. These squares are chosen independently, and can be changed into different terrain types.

stances.name: Roiling Stance
stances.desc: The ground around those that have mastered the Roiling Stance is nearly a liquid, quaking and shaking constantly.
stances.accumulate: Gain 1 _Momentum_ for every hostile creature beyond the first in your Burst at Resolution, up to a maximum of 3.
stances.effect: Create a Burst 2 centered on you that moves with you. Creatures treat the spaces in this Burst around you as _Difficult Terrain_.
stances.special: Whenever you _Expose_ a creature within the Burst created by this effect you may pay 1 _Momentum_ to instead inflict _Prone_.

techniques.name: Quake
techniques.desc: A minor earthquake, firing earth upward and testing the footing of all involved.
techniques.effect: Attack all targets in the area with the below Profile.
techniques.boost: 2 Momentum. Area becomes Burst 2.

techniques.name: Cave
techniques.desc: A powerful technique that creates a cave below the ground, then collapses the ground downwards, sending enemies into a painful fall.
techniques.effect: Immediately create _Rough Terrain_ in the area. At Resolution, resolve the below Attack in the same area.
techniques.boost: 2 _Momentum_. Area becomes a Blast 3.

techniques.name: Jagged Earth
techniques.desc: Blades of the earth appear out of nowhere, suddenly striking a foe.
techniques.effect: Attack with the below Profile. Immediately after resolving the attack, create _Dangerous Terrain_ (Physical) adjacent to the target.
techniques.boost: 1 _Momentum_. This attack becomes _Accurate_.

techniques.name: Earth Tomb
techniques.desc: By using nearby earth and stone the Earthbonded seals their foe away.
techniques.target: A Size 1 creature adjacent to at least two Earthen Features.
techniques.effect: Attack the target with the below Profile, destroying both Earthen Features. On a Hit or Crit, _Entomb_ the creature in an Earthen Barricade. A creature may end _Entomb_ by spending 3 _Grit_ on their turn. If a creature spends _Skill_, they must immediately Move 1 and fall _Prone_. An Earthen Barricade is then created in their original square. If they cannot Move, they may not spend _Skill_.
techniques.special: If there are four adjacent Earthen Features adjacent: Either this Attack is _Accurate_, or you may target a Size 2 creature. Destroy all Earthen Features used for this Attack.

techniques.name: Tremors
techniques.desc: The Earthbonded shakes the earth around them, making a sure footing impossible.
techniques.effect: Attack all targets in the area using the below Profile.
techniques.boost: 2 Momentum. Area becomes Boost 2.

techniques.name: Quicksand
techniques.desc: Liquified earth threatens to swallow the unaware whole.
techniques.effect: The target square becomes _Rough Terrain_. The first Size 1 creature to move into that square without spending 1 Skill is immediately swallowed up by the earth, rapidly sinking into the Quicksand. That creature is _Restrained_ until they Sacrifice an Action and spend _Skill_ to escape. An adjacent creature can also Sacrifice an Action to free a creature from _Restrained_. A creature _Restrained_ by Quicksand takes 3 True Damage during the Resolution Phase.
techniques.special: A character may only have three instances of Quickand at a time, regardless of their size.
techniques.boost: 2 Momentum. You instead create the Quicksand in a Blast 2 area. Quicksand now triggers off Size 2 creatures as well. A creature must pay 1 _Skill_ for every square of the Quicksand they move through to not sink into it.

techniques.name: Spikes
techniques.desc: Hardened spikes rise up from the earth, leaving a jagged wake that is difficult to traverse.
techniques.effect: The area immediately becomes _Rough Terrain_ and _Dangerous Terrain_ (Physical). Any character in the area must expend _Skill_ or gain _Hobble_ 1.
techniques.boost: 1 _Momentum_. Place another Line 4 connected to the initial area.

techniques.name: Earthen Bulwark
techniques.desc: The Earthbonded creates a mighty wall, fortifying their position.
techniques.effect: Choose three contiguous adjacent squares. Create an Earthen Barricade in each. Any creatures in these squares are immediately moved to an adjacent square of their choice.
techniques.boost: 1 _Momentum_. Creatures of your choice moved by this ability gain _Expose_ 1 (_Skill_).

techniques.name: Earth Kinesis
techniques.desc: The Earthbonded moves the earth of the battlefield around, choosing the shape as easily as breathing.
techniques.effect:
Choose a Size 1 Earthen Feature within range. Draw up to a Line 5 from the Feature, and move it to the end of the Line. Any creatures in the Line are moved to the end of the Line unless they spend Skill or 2 Grit.
• If they spend _Skill_, they may Move 1 out of the Line. If they cannot Move out of the Line, they cannot spend _Skill_ in this way.
• If they spend _Grit_, they are not moved and the Feature is instead placed adjacent to them.
If a creature Immune to being moved is in the Line, instead place the Feature adjacent to them.
techniques.boost: 2 Momentum. You may choose a Size 2 Earthen Feature or three Size 1 Earthen Features. If you move a Size 2 Feature, it instead costs 4 Grit to not be moved. Any creatures moved take 3 Physical Damage.

techniques.name: Earthen Shield
techniques.desc: The Earthbonded throws up a barricade, only using it when the right moment strikes.
techniques.trigger: You or a creature within range is Attacked.
techniques.effect: Create an Earthen Barricade adjacent to the triggering creature. Reduce the Attack Roll by 1, and grant the triggering creature 1 Armor against the triggering Attack.

techniques.name: Burrow
techniques.desc: The Earthbonded moves through the earth like a mole, safely reaching their destination.
techniques.effect: This Movement ignores all terrain.

techniques.name: Earth Slide
techniques.desc: The Earthbonded slides the ground beneath their feet forward, potentially leaving a wake of destruction behind.
techniques.effect: You may create _Rough Terrain_ in the square you begin your Move from.
techniques.boost: A character may spend _Momentum_ to place _Rough Terrain_ in squares they moved through, at a rate of 1 _Momentum_ per 3 squares of _Rough Terrain_.

name: Boulder
flavor: The Boulder Discipline focuses on powerful strkes with great stones, creating an avalanche of heavy, driving strikes.

stances.name: Siege Stance
stances.desc: Flinging boulders is a combat staple of Earthbonded, but some are true masters of it, flinging boulders in precise arcs as soon as they are formed.
stances.accumulate: Every time you take an Action that moves or creates a Boulder, gain 1 _Momentum_.
stances.effect: Once per round in the Plotting phase, you may pay 1 _Momentum_ to change the speed of an action that creates a Boulder to Set-Up and Attach it to an action that targets a Boulder.
stances.special: When you take the Boulder Throw action, instead of drawing a Line 6 from the Boulder you may instead move it to an empty space within Range 8 of it. Attack using Boulder Throw's profile in a Burst 1 around the Boulder's new location.

stances.name: Colossus Stance
stances.desc: The Colossus specializes in heavy armor made of stone, limiting mobility but providing unparalled defense.
stances.effect: At Refresh, you may choose to become _Slowed_ for the round. If you do, while you have any _Ablative Armor_, gain Resistance to all damage originating from 4 or more sqspaces away, but you are _Slowed_.
stances.special: If you have an Earth Enchant active at Refresh, instead gain 3 _Ablative Armor_.

stances.name: Rubble Stance
stances.desc: The Rubble Stance creates stones only to destroy them, using the rubble for enhanced mobility.
stances.accumulate: Gain 1 _Momentum_ every time you Destroy a Boulder.
stances.effect: Every time you Destroy a Boulder, you may immediately Move 2 in any direction. Every time you Destroy a Boulder, you may deal 2 damage to all adjacent creatures, excluding yourself.

techniques.name: Stone Strike
techniques.desc: You fling a fist-sized stone at great speed, knocking enemies off-balance.
techniques.boost: 2 _Momentum_. Halve the Damage, but you may repeat this Strike immediately after using it.
techniques.effect: Attack with the below Profile.

techniques.name: Create Boulder
techniques.desc: Dirt and stone are formed into a mighty boulder, ready to be fired.
techniques.target: An unoccupied space within range, or a Size 1 Earthen Feature.
techniques.effect: Create a Size 1 Boulder in the target space, or replace the Earthen Feature with a Boulder.
techniques.boost: 2 _Momentum_. Instead create a Size 2 Boulder, or create two additional Size 1 Boulders. This only costs 1 _Momentum_ if all Boulders created are replacing Earthen Features.

techniques.name: Boulder Throw
techniques.desc: A boulder is launced in a straight line, bludgeoning all in its path.
techniques.effect: Draw a Line 6 from the Target, Attacking with the below Profile against all targets in the area. Move the Boulder to the end of this Line after attacking.
techniques.boost: 1 _Momentum_ for each Size about 1 the Target is.
techniques.special: For each Size above 1 the target Boulder is, this Strike deals +1 damage on a Graze, Hit, or Crit.

techniques.name: Rockslide
techniques.trigger: A creature enters a square adjacent to a Boulder within Range.
techniques.desc: A sudden shift of a boulder, throwing an enemy off-course.
techniques.effect: Attack the triggering target with the below Profile. If you _Push_ the target, move the Boulder so it is still adjacent to the target.
techniques.special: If this _Push_ moves the target adjacent to a new Boulder, you may pay the Cost again to repeat the Attack. A Boulder may only be used to attack once per turn.

techniques.name: Avalanche
techniques.desc: The Earthbound siezes control of all nearby boulders, flinging them in a great wave.
techniques.effect: Move all Targets 1 space in the same direction. If this would move the Target into an occupied space, Attack with the below profile. If this attack Pushes, continue moving the Target.
techniques.boost: X _Momentum_. For every Momentum spent, move all Targets 1 additional space, deal 1 additional damage, and increase this Attack's Push by 1.

techniques.name: Stone Shield
techniques.target: Unoccupied adjacent spaces within Range, or two adjacent Size 1 Earthen Feature.
techniques.desc: A slab of stone becomes a barrier, defending against ranged attacks.
techniques.effect: Create a Line 2 Boulder in unoccupied spaces within Range. At the start of each of your Turns, you may Move the Stone Shield up to 3 spaces, and rotate it up to 90 degrees. The Stone Shield can move through occupied squares, but may not end its movement there.
techniques.special: You may end this Enchant at the end of any of your turns and immediately fire the Stone Shield forward. Immediately use the Boulder Throw Technique with the Stone Shield, ignoring the typical Range of the ability.
techniques.boost: 2 _Momentum_. Instead create a Line 3 Boulder.

techniques.name: Stone Gauntlet
techniques.desc: A fist of cobblestones forms around your hand, making unnarmed strikes hit like an avalanche.
techniques.effect: Equip the Stone Gauntlet Spirit Weapon in your Open Hand. This Enchant ends if you have no Stone Gauntlets Equipped.
techniques.boost: 0 _Momentum_. If you have two Open Hands, you may equip a Stone Gauntlet in each.

techniques.name: Chip Damage
techniques.trigger: You take Damage while having any _Ablative Armor_ created by an Earth Technique.
techniques.desc: You manipulate the shards of your shattered armor, striking back against your enemies.
techniques.effect: Attack all targets in the area with the below Profile.
techniques.boost: X _Ablative Armor_. For each _Ablative Armor_ spent, deal 2 additional damage on a Hit or Crit.

techniques.name: Avalanche Charge
techniques.desc: You charge forward, amplifying your speed by smashing through stones.
techniques.effect: During the Movement granted by this effect you can Move through Boulders, destroying them in the process. Gain 1 _Ablative Armor_ for every Boulder destroyed in this way. If you Attach this to an Attack, deal +1 damage on a Hit or Crit for each Boulder destroyed in this way.
techniques.special: All Movement granted by this Technique must be in a straight line, and must pass through at least one Boulder.

techniques.name: Earthfall
techniques.desc: A quick coat of stone covers the weapon, amplifying the weight of the strike and leaving rubble near the target.
techniques.effect: Attack using your weapon's Profile. If you Hit or Crit, you may add _Push_ 1 (Grit) to the attack. Regardless, create a Boulder in a square Adjacent to you.

techniques.name: Stonescreen
techniques.desc: With a powerful strike a boulder is shattered, staggering and pushing all nearby.
techniques.effect: Destroy the Target. Attack in a Burst 1 around the Target using the below Profile. The area is _Veiled_ for two _Phases_.
techniques.boost: X _Momentum_. The Range is instead X*2.

techniques.name: Fracture
techniques.desc: A boulder within range detonates, sending a blast of stone shrapnel shredding through nearby enemies.
techniques.effect: Attack with the below Profile in a Burst 1 around the Target, then Destroy the Target.
techniques.boost: 2 _Momentum_. You may choose a Size 2 Boulder. Instead of Destroying the Boulder, replace it with 4 Size 1 Boulders, then move each Boulder one space diagonally away from the previous Boulder's center.

name: Grounding
flavor: The Grounding Stance allows characters to anchor themselves to the earth, becoming unmovable and immensely strong.

stances.name: Heavy Stance
stances.desc: The Earthbonded amplifies their weight massively, becoming an unmoving bastion.

stances.name: Mighty Stance
stances.desc: By drawing upon the earth the Earthbonded's strength becomes inhuman and a mighty driving force.

stances.name: Titan Stance
stances.desc: A difficult Stance to master, the Titan Stance allows an Earthbonded to make use of impossibly large weapons with ease.

name: Stoneheart
flavor: The Stoneheart Stance channels the essence of the earth to make one's heart like stone and impenetrable to fear.

name: Tremorsight
flavor: Tremorsight allows an Earthbonded to read the vibrations of the earth, providing perfect knowledge of everything touching the ground.

name: Blaze
flavor: The Blaze Stance possesses the archetypal Flamebonded techniques, centered around manipulating and conjuring flames.

name: Burn
flavor: The Burn Stance makes use of flames in a more immediate fashion, wreathing the Flamebonded and those nearby in all-consuming flames.

name: Overheat
flavor: The Overheat Stance overclocks the natural processes of the body, providing a Flamebonded exceptional physical performance at the expense of their physical well-being.

name: Bloodboil
flavor: Those that practice Bloodboil manipulate the rage in themselves and others, allowing them to paint targets across the battlefield.

name: Flashsight
flavor: Flashsight allows Flamebonded to see brief flashes of the future in flames, providing a limited sense of clairvoyance.

name: Irondraw
flavor: Irondraw allows a Metalbonded to push and pull metal, providing exceptional defense and offense so long as there is a source of metal nearby.

name: Steelforge
flavor: Steelforging changes to properties of nearby metal, whether that be making it razor-sharp or distorting its shape for an unexpected strike.

name: Soldertear
flavor: Metalbonded can manipulate the grief and sorrow in others with Soldertear Technique, crushing their foes with feelings of hopelessness.

name: Tide
flavor: The Tide Stance focusing on pushing and pulling water, crushing foes in an oncoming wave while dictating the flow of a battle.

name: Tundra
flavor: Conjuring great constructs out of ice, masters of the Tundra Stance create weapons as beautiful as they are deadly.

name: Bloodbind
flavor: A skilled Waterbonded can control blood like any other liquid, either to staunch bleeding and heal or turn foes into gruesome puppets.

name: Still Waters
flavor: Water Spirits can easily drown out intense emotions, creating a sense of calm through Still Water Techniques.

name: Rippleread
flavor: Water can reach into the past, allowing a Waterbonded to see the history of objects, or force a foe to briefly experience past trauma.

name: Gale
flavor: The most common Windbound discipline, masters of the Gale Stance control powerful gusts of wind and create minor tornadoes.

name: Storm
flavor: Channeling the essence of a thunderstorm, the Storm Stance creates powerful bursts of lighting that ripple over the battlefield.

name: Zephyr
flavor: The Zephyr Stance carries the body slightly aloft, allowing speed and reactions that push the limits of human capability.

name: Howl
flavor: Howl Stance masters channel ancient, primal fear of storms and winds to shake enemies to their core, sending them fleeing from the battle.

name: Windwhisper
flavor: The Windwhisper Stance reads currents in the air, allowing an incredible ability to predict and react to attacks.

name: Bark
flavor: The Bark Stance controls wood, allowing them to push the limits of wooden weapons and shift the shape of wood at-will.

name: Growth
flavor: By manipulating local plantlife, Growth Techniques can turn a barren field into one choked with aggressive, hostile plantlife.

name: Bloom
flavor: The Bloom Stance is one of the most beloved of the Wood Disciplines, as it can spark joy and happiness in themselves and others.
